comment.text:
Works for me: 1 desktop & 2 laptops all using the Mate Desktop Environment.

sirius: desktop 16GB Intel i7-3770 CPU – real:10m0.151s user:4m35.980s sys:4m50.094s

sedna: laptop 8GB Intel i5-2520M CPU Lenovo T420 – real:106m53.822s user:73m40.371s sys:34m9.800s N.B.  sedna is running more than 10 times slower than it has previously

mercury: laptop 32GB AMD Ryzen 7 5700U with Radeon 5500 Graphics – rea1:14m21.262s user:6m43.405s sys:5m31.973s

Looks ok for me. Runs since it was ready in koji. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed.
sometimes i have to double-post the comments. It seems that sometimes bodhi does not accept the first try...
i7-9700K(UHD Graphics 630): kernel regression test passed. Works fine for daily use.

I get
 https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=215137
on all three hard disks in my PC.
This is a regression from 5.15.4
Regression testing OK on Dell Precision T5610 2 x Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2603 v2 @ 1.80GHz (8 cores total) however I think https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=215137 is a bit scary.
Works on vm
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)

same problem. for me it:
1) throws an error
2) appears not to update this page but the result is there if you kill the tab and come back in
3) running datagrepper on bodhi.update.comment shows no result

been happening for about a week I'd say

Can you plz crosscheck this bug here?

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2027040

Finally my system able to suspend (also wake up from suspend), reboot, and power off on kernel 5.15. 

System: AMD A9-9420 RADEON R5
Regression tests pass, general usage works, seems like a solid update. Hopefully all Radeon power management fixes will land soon in 5.15.X
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)
Works fine Acer Aspire Intel® Core™ i7-3632QM CPU @ 2.20GHz Memory: 15.4 GiB of RAM Graphics Processor: Mesa DRI Intel® HD Graphics 4000 no regressions.
Works fine Acer Aspire Intel® Core™ i7-3632QM CPU @ 2.20GHz Memory: 15.4 GiB of RAM Graphics Processor: Mesa DRI Intel® HD Graphics 4000 no regressions.

Looks ok for me. Runs since it was ready in koji. Works on baremetal (non UEFI mode) AMD Ryzen5 3600, Mainboard MSI B450M Mortar Max with prop. nvidia driver from rpmfusion.org (GTX980 card). Works with Gnome-Desktop (Xorg). Regression test passed.

Actually, given https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=215137, which I can confirm on both of my machines with SSD drives, this should probably not go to stable. I do not see reports of corruption or data loss in that bug, but it seems it upset a few folks.
Gigabyte GA-B150M-D3H Mainboard with Intel i7 6700k; Radeon RX 580; 64 GB DDR4-3200
Default & performance tests pass (KVM)
LGTM. No regressions noted.

Works for me...    
The regression tests pass OK. AMD 965, x86_64 work station, SSD's > RAID1. Plasma DE from Zawertun's COPR. Running Xorg, nVidia GT1030 card using nVidia RPM's from RPMFusion (495.44)
Gigabyte GA-B150M-D3H Mainboard with Intel i7 6700k; Radeon RX 580; 64 GB DDR4-3200

Brightness control does not work on  fedora 34, tried on all 5.15 kernels.

Laptop: ASUS Zenbook UM325, AMD Ryzen 5600U with integrated radeon.

Seems to be an amdgpu problem.

Brightness controls work after suspend/resume.

Value on /sys/class/backlight/amdgpu_bl0/actual_brightness shows value change but the brightness does not change.
Gigabyte GA-B150M-D3H Mainboard with Intel i7 6700k; Radeon RX 580; 64 GB DDR4-3200

It looks good, but laptop heats up more with this kernel for no apparent reason.
Asus Zephyrus G14 2021
AMD® Ryzen 7 5800hs
NVIDIA Corporation GA107M [GeForce RTX 3050 Ti Mobile]

The power profiles just started to fully work (performance profile is present now) with 5.15.x updates.
Can I get someone to please post the kernel headers for this update? VirtualBox requires it to update to the latest VB environment.

kernel-headers are not required for Fedora, other distros name what we call kernel-devel as kernel-headers.  See http://thorstenl.blogspot.com/2021/01/package-names-can-be-false-friends-too.html

kernel-headers is not build specific, and rarely gets updated in a kernel-series. It is used to build userspace programs. Kernel-devel is built with every kernel, must be version specific, and is used to build kernel modules.

bugs.title: CVE-2021-4001 kernel: race condition when the EBPF map is frozen

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-4001 kernel: race condition when the EBPF map is frozen

long_desc.thetext:
A race problem is found in the ebpf verifier between bpf_map_update_elem and bpf_map_freeze due to a missing lock in kernel/bpf/syscall.c. In this flaw, a local user with a special privilege (cap_sys_admin or cap_bpf) can modify the frozen mapped address space.

Reference and upstream patch:
https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/bpf/bpf.git/commit/?id=353050be4c19e102178ccc05988101887c25ae53

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2025646]

bugs.title: CVE-2021-4001 kernel: race condition when the EBPF map is frozen [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2021-4001 kernel: race condition when the EBPF map is frozen [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2021-4001 kernel: race condition when the EBPF map is frozen

long_desc.thetext:
A race problem is found in the ebpf verifier between bpf_map_update_elem and bpf_map_freeze due to a missing lock in kernel/bpf/syscall.c. In this flaw, a local user with a special privilege (cap_sys_admin or cap_bpf) can modify the frozen mapped address space.

Reference and upstream patch:
https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/bpf/bpf.git/commit/?id=353050be4c19e102178ccc05988101887c25ae53

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2025646]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2025645,2025646

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 35. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3
FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d has been submitted as an update to Fedora 34. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d

FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d has been pushed to the Fedora 34 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3 has been pushed to the Fedora 35 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --advisory=FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2021-c0dc424b7d has been pushed to the Fedora 34 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2021-19ad835cb3 has been pushed to the Fedora 35 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text:
Brightness control does not work on  fedora 34, tried on all 5.15 kernels.

Laptop: ASUS Zenbook UM325, AMD Ryzen 5600U with integrated radeon.

Seems to be an amdgpu problem.

Brightness controls work after suspend/resume.

Value on /sys/class/backlight/amdgpu_bl0/actual_brightness shows value change but the brightness does not change.
This update has been submitted for stable by jforbes.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes: The 5.15.5 stable kernel update contains a number of important fixes across the tree.
title: kernel-5.15.5-100.fc34
